{{cpp/named req/title|Hash|notes={{mark since c++11}}}}
{{cpp/named req/navbar}}

A {{named req|Hash}} is a function object for which the output depends only on the input and has a very low probability of yielding the same output given different input values.

===Requirements===
The type {{tt|T}} satisfies {{named req/core|Hash}} if

* The type {{tt|T}} satisfies {{named req|FunctionObject}}, {{named req|CopyConstructible}}, {{named req|Destructible}}, and

Given
* {{c|h}}, a value of type {{tt|T}} or {{tt|const T}}, whose argument type is {{tt|Key}},
* {{c|k}}, a value of type convertible to {{tt|Key}} or {{c|const Key}},
* {{c|u}}, an [[cpp/language/value_category|lvalue]] expression of type {{tt|Key}}.

The following expressions must be valid and have their specified effects.

{|table class=wikitable
|-
!Expression||Return type||Requirements
|-
|{{c|h(k)}}
|{{lc|std::size_t}}
|The returned value depends only on the value of {{c|k}} for the duration of the program.
All evaluations of {{c|h(k)}} executed within a given execution of a program yield the same result for the same value of {{c|k}}.

The probability of {{c|1=h(a) == h(b)}} for {{c|1=a != b}} should approach {{c|1.0 / std::numeric_limits&lt;std::size_t&gt;::max()}}.
|-
|{{c|h(u)}}
|{{lc|std::size_t}}
|{{c|u}} is not modified.
|}
